header: Criminal Bail Application No.87/2019 CNR NO. MHPU01­000360­2019 Dr. Sunil Purshottam Dev and another …. Applicants. Vs. State of Maharashtra …. Respondent.

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH.4 Present four applicants have filed the application for interim bail under Section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code in connection with C.R.No.06/2019, registered by Sangavi police station, for the offence punishable under section 420 r/w 34 of the Indian Penal Code.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of criminal procedure code
under section 420 r/w 34 of the indian penal code

arguments.text: [2] Heard learned advocate Mr. Bipin Patole for the applicants and learned advocate Mr. Sameer Ghatge for the informant. Learned advocate Mr. Patole as well as learned advocate Mr. Ghatge both in order to substantiate their contentions took me through the FIR in the present crime. Learned advocate Mr. Patole argued that the allegations in the FIR are vague. The informant herself claimed to be the devotee of Amma Bhagwan and when she has donated certain amount, how can she claim that she was cheated. Per­contra, learned advocate Mr. Ghatge submitted that the informant was induced to part with huge amount in cash as well as in kind in terms of gold and, therefore, the allegations made in the FIR are sufficient to show that applicants have cheated the informant. He also submitted that not only the present informant but other persons are also cheated and for thorough investigation, the custodial interrogation of the applicants is necessary.

argumentSentences.text: [2] Heard learned advocate Mr. Bipin Patole for the applicants and learned advocate Mr. Sameer Ghatge for the informant.
Learned advocate Mr. Patole as well as learned advocate Mr. Ghatge both in order to substantiate their contentions took me through the FIR in the present crime.
Learned advocate Mr. Patole argued that the allegations in the FIR are vague.
The informant herself claimed to be the devotee of Amma Bhagwan and when she has donated certain amount, how can she claim that she was cheated.

Per­contra, learned advocate Mr. Ghatge submitted that the informant was induced to part with huge amount in cash as well as in kind in terms of gold and, therefore, the allegations made in the FIR are sufficient to show that applicants have cheated the informant.
He also submitted that not only the present informant but other persons are also cheated and for thorough investigation, the custodial interrogation of the applicants is necessary.

arguments.text: [3] I have gone through the FIR. Also, I may note that in two similar bail applications in connection with the present crime, this court has granted interim anticipatory bail to the applicants and those Criminal Bail Applications are kept for hearing on 19­01­2019. Considering the rival contentions and allegations in the FIR, I find it proper to grant interim protection to the applicants till respondent i.e. Sangavi police station file its reply to the application. Hence, I pass the following order.

argumentSentences.text: [3] I have gone through the FIR.

Also, I may note that in two similar bail applications in connection with the present crime, this court has granted interim anticipatory bail to the applicants and those Criminal Bail Applications are kept for hearing on 19­01­2019.

Considering the rival contentions and allegations in the FIR, I find it proper to grant interim protection to the applicants till respondent i.e. Sangavi police station file its reply to the application.
Hence, I pass the following order.

order.text: ORDER [1] The interim anticipatory bail is granted. In the event of arrest of applicant Nos.[1] Dr. Sunil Purshottam Dev, [2] Ms. Nivedina Y. Madhavi, [3] Ms. Vishita @ Radha, and [4] Mr. Amit Gajanan Banarase in C. R. No. 06/2019 registered by Sangavi Police Station, under Section 420, 34 of the Indian Penal Code, applicants be released on their furnishing P.R. Bond of Rs.20,000/­ each with one or two sureties of like amount, on following conditions :­ [A] The applicants shall not tamper with the prosecution evidence in any manner. [B] The applicants shall co­operate the Investigating Officer during investigation and they shall remain present before the I. O. as and when required for interrogation. [C] The applicants shall not leave the jurisdiction of this court without prior permission of this Court. [2] This order of interim anticipatory bail shall remain in force till 19­01­2019. Cri.B.A.No. 87/2019 3 CNR No.MHPU01­000360­2019 [3] The applicants shall remain present before this court on the date of hearing of main application. [4] Issue notice to the respondent, returnable on 19­01­ 2019. [5] Inform concerned police station accordingly.

footer: Pune, Dated/­05­01­2019 ( Aniruddha Y. Thatte ) Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. I affirm that the contents of the PDF file Judgment are same word for word as per original Judgment. Name of Steno :- Shri. V. V. Bannur Name of Court : Shri. A. Y. Thatte, District Judge 15 and ASJ, Pune, Judgment signed by PO on : - 5-1-2019 Judgment uploaded on :- 5-1-2019
processedText:
Criminal Bail Application No.87/2019 CNR NO. MHPU01­000360­2019 Dr. Sunil Purshottam Dev and another …. Applicants. Vs. State of Maharashtra …. Respondent. 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH.4 Present four applicants have filed the application for interim bail under Section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code in connection with C.R.No.06/2019, registered by Sangavi police station, for the offence punishable under section 420 r/w 34 of the Indian Penal Code. 
---background-ends---
[2] Heard learned advocate Mr. Bipin Patole for the applicants and learned advocate Mr. Sameer Ghatge for the informant. Learned advocate Mr. Patole as well as learned advocate Mr. Ghatge both in order to substantiate their contentions took me through the FIR in the present crime. Learned advocate Mr. Patole argued that the allegations in the FIR are vague. The informant herself claimed to be the devotee of Amma Bhagwan and when she has donated certain amount, how can she claim that she was cheated. Per­contra, learned advocate Mr. Ghatge submitted that the informant was induced to part with huge amount in cash as well as in kind in terms of gold and, therefore, the allegations made in the FIR are sufficient to show that applicants have cheated the informant. He also submitted that not only the present informant but other persons are also cheated and for thorough investigation, the custodial interrogation of the applicants is necessary. 
---argument-ends---
[3] I have gone through the FIR. Also, I may note that in two similar bail applications in connection with the present crime, this court has granted interim anticipatory bail to the applicants and those Criminal Bail Applications are kept for hearing on 19­01­2019. Considering the rival contentions and allegations in the FIR, I find it proper to grant interim protection to the applicants till respondent i.e. Sangavi police station file its reply to the application. Hence, I pass the following order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER [1] The interim anticipatory bail is granted. In the event of arrest of applicant Nos.[1] Dr. Sunil Purshottam Dev, [2] Ms. Nivedina Y. Madhavi, [3] Ms. Vishita @ Radha, and [4] Mr. Amit Gajanan Banarase in C. R. No. 06/2019 registered by Sangavi Police Station, under Section 420, 34 of the Indian Penal Code, applicants be released on their furnishing P.R. Bond of Rs.20,000/­ each with one or two sureties of like amount, on following conditions :­ [A] The applicants shall not tamper with the prosecution evidence in any manner. [B] The applicants shall co­operate the Investigating Officer during investigation and they shall remain present before the I. O. as and when required for interrogation. [C] The applicants shall not leave the jurisdiction of this court without prior permission of this Court. [2] This order of interim anticipatory bail shall remain in force till 19­01­2019. Cri.B.A.No. 87/2019 3 CNR No.MHPU01­000360­2019 [3] The applicants shall remain present before this court on the date of hearing of main application. [4] Issue notice to the respondent, returnable on 19­01­ 2019. [5] Inform concerned police station accordingly. 
---order-ends---
Pune, Dated/­05­01­2019 ( Aniruddha Y. Thatte ) Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. I affirm that the contents of the PDF file Judgment are same word for word as per original Judgment. Name of Steno :- Shri. V. V. Bannur Name of Court : Shri. A. Y. Thatte, District Judge 15 and ASJ, Pune, Judgment signed by PO on : - 5-1-2019 Judgment uploaded on :- 5-1-2019
